H0.text: Bacteria are an abiotic factor contributing to the energy cycle of a mangrove ecosystem.

H1.text: Climate is an abiotic factor contributing to the energy cycle of a mangrove ecosystem.

H2.text: Fungi are an abiotic factor contributing to the energy cycle of a mangrove ecosystem.

H3.text: Rocks are an abiotic factor contributing to the energy cycle of a mangrove ecosystem, which is affected by several factors.

A4.text: Bacteria and protozoans colonise the plant litter and break it down chemically into organic compounds, minerals, carbon dioxide, and nitrogenous wastes.

A5.text: These trees cannot endure freezing temperatures, which restricts their distribution to warmer climates.
